steps.beforeText: What is the average slope between 40 and 100 seconds?

Incorrect.

Click on a point at one end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds.

Then click "OK".

Incorrect.

The point you have selected is not a point at one end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds. Try again.

Click on a point at one end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds.

Then click "OK".

Now click on the point at the other end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds.

Then click "OK".

Incorrect.

Your points should be adjacent.

Now click on the point at the other end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds.

Then click "OK".

Incorrect.

You have selected the same point twice.

Now click on the point at the other end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds.

Then click "OK".

Incorrect.

The point you have selected is not a point at one end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds. Try again.

Now click on the point at the other end of the interval from 40 seconds to 100 seconds.

Then click "OK".

Here is the line connecting the two points.

What is the average slope between 40 and 100 seconds?

Incorrect.

What is the average slope between 40 and 100 seconds?

Hint: Recall that the slope is the change in distance divided by the change in time.

Incorrect.

What was the change in distance between the two points in meters?

Hint: Look at the graph.

Incorrect.

What was the change in distance between the two points in meters?

Hint: Look at the table and the graph.

What was the change in time between the two points in seconds?

Hint: Look at the graph.

Incorrect.

What was the change in time between the two points in seconds?

Hint: Look at the graph and the table.

Incorrect.

The change in seconds between the points is %@ - %@, or %@.
If the change in distance is %@ meters and the change in time is %@ seconds then what is the slope in m/s?

Incorrect.

If the change in distance is %@ meters and the change in time is %@ seconds then what is the slope in m/s?

Hint: Remember that it is the change in distance divided by the change in time.

Incorrect.

If the change in distance is %@ meters and the change in time is %@ seconds, the slope is %@ divided by %@, or %@ m/s.
